catalog_info.title: Electrical, Optical, and Magnetic Properties of Materials
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Introductory solid-state physics or equivalent course.
catalog_info.description: This course covers the electrical, optical and magnetic properties of several technologically important materials systems. It provides a general introduction of structure-property relations; defect chemistry including Kroger-Vink diagram and charged point defect; ionic conductivity in electrochemical intercalation energy storage materials; optical properties of wide bandgap metal oxides; spin, charge and crystal structure coupling, and their ordering and disordering.
